title: Restaurant Conversations
description: Master essential phrases for dining out in Germany. Learn how to order food, ask questions, and handle restaurant interactions confidently.

prompts.text: Ich hätte gern einen Tisch für zwei Personen
prompts.translation: I would like a table for two people

prompts.text: Können wir die Speisekarte sehen bitte?
prompts.translation: Can we see the menu please?

prompts.text: Ich nehme das Schnitzel mit Pommes
prompts.translation: I'll have the schnitzel with fries

microNotes.text: Modal verbs like 'hätte' (would like) and 'können' (can) are used for polite requests in German.
In German, the verb typically comes second in main clauses, even with modal verbs.
